result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon F. Fernandes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Info (2nd+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs through DOC.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol or any other drugs.
Defendant shall submit to random testing at request of law enforcement or DOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon F. Fernandes

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon F. Fernandes appeared by video, in custody of Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Brandon F. Fernandes. Per agreement, defendant to plead to charge with 2 years probation, comply with sex offender registry and $300 fine plus costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant freely waives personal appearance. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Ocwieja heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders sentence withheld, probation 2 years, consecutive to sentence now serving, with conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol or any other drugs; random testing on request of law enforcement or DOC, pay court costs as condition of probation. Court explains felony loss of rights.

Defendant Brandon F. Fernandes not in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Brandon F. Fernandes. Attorney Ocwieja believes defendant is at Dodge Correctional. Attorney Ocweija heard on status of case and requests another status date. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Per SPD 4/4/22, Attorney Michael Murphy is not willing to take this case since he can't appear via zoom. jk

Defendant Brandon F. Fernandes in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by phone for Brandon F. Fernandes.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank heard and moves to withdraw as counsel. Attorney Michael Murphy represents defendant in Lafayette County. Defendant requests Attorney Murphy be appointed on this case. Court advises defendant that his counsel should be aware that counsel is not allowed to appear by zoom in this court. Five felonies are pending in Lafayette County. Court allows Attorney Frank to withdraw. Defendant to go directly to SPD for new counsel to be assigned. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court reviews waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court find defendant knowingly and freely waives his right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea. Status date set.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon F. Fernandes appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and defendant's right counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests $1000 cash bond. Defendant heard. Court sets $1000 signature bond. Court sets status date.
